extendedInfo.description: Sync Slate is a digital slate or clapper board for film enthusiasts. It differs from the other, highly competent, existing apps in one fundamental way, the interface is designed to be vertical and uncluttered. This app offers some additional features & utilities, including online data storage of screenplay and shot log, and an still image gallery in the app.This is a release candidate, with a free trial period of 60 days.WARNING: - This is a release candidate, looking for friendly testers.- The trail period of next release will be reduced to 14 days.- The online services are currently in development.

reviews.title: Needs Frame Accurate Time Code
reviews.comment: NTSC (U.S.) video shoots at 30 frames/second. PAL (European) is 25 FPS, and film is 24 FPS. A timecode slate needs to be accurate to the exact frame of the format you are using. Thus your time in this beta version is accurate to the 1/10th of a second which does not match the frame rate of video or film formats. If you are even one or two frames off in editing the lips do not sync right. I suggest you make a user option to show time down to 24, 25 or 30 frames per second.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I love it!
reviews.comment: A great tool for keeping track of shots, takes, and scenes, and their quality. Amazing for being beta, hope for timecode in the final release though.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: best Slate app for Android I\'ve seen so far, runs great on my EVO 3D. The time does runs & everything works very feature rich for beta
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lacking key features-no landscape view
reviews.comment: Had high hopes but it doesn\'t, really deliver. No proper SMPTE time code, no ability to link to audio files for music video production. Clap noise is almost inaudible compared to  proper board. Text is too small to read on certain focal lengths. Vertical only operation so if you have a nice nexus10, it\'s wasted. There\'s also a load of programming code on screen.  Disappointed with this poor app when the market potential for one that actually works is massive.
reviews.author: Kenny Evans

reviews.title: Best out there unfortunatly
reviews.comment: Needs some ux work.. Too fidlly when shooting rushed scenes. Dev needs to take on feedback quickly to avoid better apps coming on the market
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not Quite Ready
reviews.comment: I want to love this app. It shows a lot of potential and has some really nice features, but...  ...it\'s totally jacked on my S3. The debug info is onscreen all the time, regardless of the setting. Not too responsive as I tap around. AND it won\'t work on my Nexus 7 or Galaxy Note 10.1. That\'s what I really want.  Is this still in development?
reviews.author: Hal Robertson

reviews.title: UI screws up
reviews.comment: User interface is completely screwed up on my galaxy ace
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Fantastic. Perfect cell phone slate when I\'m working with a small crew. The clap sound is useless however( echos). Electronic alternate is okay.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Still waiting for Honeycomb
reviews.comment: It is very useful however it will be best if they took advantage of the screen of Honeycomb tablets. Time code is also missing.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: not quite what\'s advertised
reviews.comment: it\'s understandable that it\'s in beta but...  it\'s no where close to clean, has no documentation, and doesn\'t appear to do what it\'s expected to do.  that being said, i\'ll try it again when it get\'s more mature.   of course, I\'M doing digital video production and don\'t need anything beyond the clapper...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best of a poor bunch
reviews.comment: Much better than other Android slates; has logging and decent UI. Needs fullscreen, landscape, and UI cleanup.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Text too small
reviews.comment: I like the idea. But on my S4 the text is way too small.
reviews.author: Dustan Holland

reviews.comment: Doesn\'t work on my lg. Wish it did.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Needs running time or timecode,not stopwatch.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: typo
reviews.comment: Your app says, \"Marking the slate cuases the stopwatch to automatically start.\"  \"causes\" is the correct word
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Love the concept. Would love it if it was possible to choose from a few color schemes (ie white with black text and have the option of color sticks)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Amazing app I just wish that they add or make a new app for the script its amazing
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I should think it is great, I created it. Please help me make the rating less bias. :P
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: This thing sux.
reviews.comment: Idk why people are saying that this is so kool but I can\'t figure anything out and u can\'t even put the slate down.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t fit on my screen.
reviews.comment: I have a relativity small screen and this app simply doesn\'t fit, making it useless for me. Looks like a good app, but if everything doesnt fit on one screen it wont work. Might check back on it after a while though. It looks like it has some potential.
reviews.author: A Google User
